description:
Canyon was explored but not fully descended. Top narrows are choked with brush leading to a short series of drops with potholes. These were deep, extremely stagnant, covered with a layer of thick green algae, and contained rotting animals. This canyon will be worthwhile in early spring with fresh water.

Approach

From the road walk either drainage to their confluence and the start of the route.

Descent

R1: ~80 feet off small tree DCL into deep murky pothole

This is the only rappel descended.

From here, expect 2 to 4 more drops depending on whether stages are combined.

Exit

There is a break in the cliff walls where you can scramble up to the rim at approximately 35.14663, -111.57436. This is a rough estimate meant to approximate the section. From here look for a game trail that zig zags up to the rim.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

Initial Exploration by Cooper Smith and Eric Moorcroft on 8-7-23.
name: StewPot Canyon
